title: Administer IdM in OO Workflow Designer
content:
The IdM administration console provides identity management services from the Operations Orchestration (OO) Workflow Designer interface. It helps to manage permissions, users, roles, and groups for multiple applications.

Role Location Permissions required
System Administrator or any user IdM Administration Console of OO Workflow Designer Create and edit user permissions

The IdM administration console is available only when the OO Workflow Designer is installed with Create IDM service or Connect to an existing IDM Service mode.

Access IdM administration console

You can access the IdM console from the following navigation bar.
The link to the IdM Admin icon is available only to the admin user configured at the time of installation.

  1. On the upper-right corner of the OO Workflow Designer application, click the IdM console icon   . The IdM Administration Console appears.
  2. Navigate to Idm Admin using the URL https://designerhost:designerport/idm-admin.
    Example: https://somehost:8445/idm-admin.

Manage organization

In the ORGANIZATIONS tab, you can perform add and remove organization tasks:

Add organization 

  1. From IdM Administration, click   on the top left menu to create an organization.
  2. Enter the following information for a new organization: Name, Display Name, Integration User, and Password.
  3. Click Save.

Delete organization

  1. From IdM Administration, click   on the top left menu to delete the organization.
  2. Click the action button   on the right top of the organization that you want to delete.
  3. Click REMOVE on the window that pops out to confirm the organization delete.

View organization 

Click an organization, the overview tab provides the general information of the organization.

Manage system settings

In the System Settings tab, you can view, and set up a basic, and advanced setting, if you have the following permission.

Role Location Permission required
System Administrator or any user IdM Administration Console of OO Workflow Designer systemSettingsManage permission

Set up basic system settings

  1. In the IdM Administration Console, click System Settings on the top menu to set the configuration for the IdM instance which will apply to all organizations.
  2. To prolong the IdM request token time, set the Request Token Life Time and Access Token Lifetime tags respectively.
  3. To view the basic system settings refer to the following table:
    String Name Display Name Description
    TOKEN
         		 Encrypted signing key Keys used to calculate the message digest to validate the message integrity.
    Access Token Lifetime IDM token lifetime in minutes. Users can change the Access token lifetime to prolong the lifetime of the management portal.
    Request Token Life Time IdM request token lifetime in minutes.
    SSO Creation Domain The LWSSO creation attribute domain
    Initial String Key for encryption/decryption of the LWSSO token. This is the shared secret of all servers protected by LWSSO and connected to the same authentication point server. Therefore, it must be identical in all configurations of all servers in the system. By default, users must configure a valid key string that contains at least one number and one alphabet. The minimum strength is 32 characters.
    SSO Trusted Domains This parameter is only visible in the advanced view. LWSSO multiple domain configuration. Trusted domains in DNS names.
    LDAP Extended attributes Properties for LDAP configuration.
    Nested Group Level LDAP nested group level
    SAML Entity Base URL The entity ID of the IdM's SAML metadata will be based on this URL.
    SSO Certificate single sign-on certificate(.PEM) for SAML
    SSO PrivateKey single sign-on private key(.PEM) for SAML

    You can switch to the advanced setting with the top right action button   . To switch to the basic setting, drag the action button   to basic.

Log out of IdM administration console

To log out of the IdM administration console:

  1. On the upper-right corner of the OO Workflow Designer application, click   IdM administration. The Administration Console Login screen appears.
